sections: Just a quick reminder that starting at 7:30pm ET (4:30pm PT) tonight,

will be hosting a subscriber-only live chat with Sirota, Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro and Colorado Attorney General Phil Weiser about GOP legal challenges that tried to suppress the vote, the ongoing legal battles about the election results and the
that Republicans could try to intervene to shift the Electoral College results.
You can start posting your questions for Sirota and the guests in the chatroom
and during the event. We suggest logging in to the event a few minutes early (or even right now) to start posting your questions.

Please note: this is our third live event and we are still getting through all the tech issues, so bear with us! And remember - video of the event will be available to subscribers once it is finished, so you won’t miss out!
PLEASE FOLLOW THESE STEPS TO PARTICIPATE:
1. Please try to use a desktop or laptop computer, and use the Chrome or Firefox browser. If you want to participate using an iPhone or iPad, you can download Crowdcast’s app
2. Copy and paste this link into your browser:
3. When you get to the website, on the right side of the page, there is a field marked “Enter password.” Copy and paste this password into the field and hit return:
4. At the prompt, enter your email address and click the sideways green triangle. Then click the checkbox to agree to the terms of service. Then click “Join Event.”
5. At the prompt, enter the name you’d like everyone to see in the chat.
6. You should be in the chat room at this point.

NOTE: If you are connected to the live broadcast and have connectivity issues, you should refresh your browser; hit "Help" at the top of the screen (which enters you into compatibility mode); and click the settings cog icon on the bottom right corner and switch to 360p resolution. You can also
. If you have technical issues, you can email
